# Mark E. Brown

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

Mark Brown  
---  
[![Mbphoto.jpg](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Mbphoto.jpg/220px-
Mbphoto.jpg)](/wiki/File:Mbphoto.jpg)  
Born | 58  
[Rogers](/wiki/Rogers,_Arkansas "Rogers, Arkansas"), [Arkansas](/wiki/Arkansas
"Arkansas"), U.S.  
Occupation | [Chief Executive Officer](/wiki/Chief_Executive_Officer "Chief Executive Officer")  
Years active | 1983–present  
Website | <http://markbrownstrategies.com>  
Notes  
Best known for "[What Happens in Vegas, Stays in
Vegas](/wiki/Las_Vegas_Convention_and_Visitors_Authority#What_Happens_here,_stays_here
"Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority")" campaign  
  
**Mark E. Brown** is an [American](/wiki/United_States "United States")
[businessman](/wiki/Businessman "Businessman") and former [CEO](/wiki/CEO
"CEO") of Zen Entertainment and a former [vice president](/wiki/Vice_president
"Vice president") of [The Howard Hughes
Corporation](/wiki/The_Howard_Hughes_Corporation "The Howard Hughes
Corporation"). His company currently has partnership deals with [ESPN
Radio](/wiki/ESPN_Radio "ESPN Radio"), [Fox Sports
Radio](/wiki/Fox_Sports_Radio "Fox Sports Radio"),[1]
[NBCSports.com](/wiki/NBCSports.com "NBCSports.com"), [Ultimate Fighting
Championship](/wiki/Ultimate_Fighting_Championship "Ultimate Fighting
Championship"), [World Wrestling
Entertainment](/wiki/World_Wrestling_Entertainment "World Wrestling
Entertainment"), and casinos such as the [Treasure Island Hotel and
Casino](/wiki/Treasure_Island_Hotel_and_Casino "Treasure Island Hotel and
Casino"), [Hard Rock Hotel](/wiki/Hard_Rock_Hotel "Hard Rock Hotel"). He is
also the former Partner and President of R&R Partners, the ad agency which
created the "[What Happens in Vegas, Stays in
Vegas](/wiki/Las_Vegas_Convention_and_Visitors_Authority#What_Happens_here,_stays_here
"Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority")" advertising campaign for the
[Las Vegas Convention and Visitors
Authority](/wiki/Las_Vegas_Convention_and_Visitors_Authority "Las Vegas
Convention and Visitors Authority").[2][3] In addition, Brown is founder and
director of Service 1st Bank of Nevada, valued in 2010 around $210 million,
and previously served as the President of MBC Communications.[4]

[hide]

  * 1 Early life and education

## Early life and
education[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Mark_E._Brown&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life and education")]

He attended the [University of Nevada, Reno](/wiki/University_of_Nevada,_Reno
"University of Nevada, Reno") and completed the Executive Program in
Management for the [John Anderson Graduate School of
Management](/wiki/UCLA_Anderson_School_of_Management "UCLA Anderson School of
Management"). He is currently a member of the Board of Trustees of the [UNLV
Foundation](/wiki/University_of_Nevada,_Las_Vegas "University of Nevada, Las
Vegas").

##
Career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Mark_E._Brown&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Career")]

Brown started out working as a senior legislative assistant on the staff of
former Nevada Senator [Chic Hecht](/wiki/Chic_Hecht "Chic Hecht"). He spent
five years in Washington, D.C. overseeing all of Hecht's U.S. Senate Banking
and Energy Committee assignments in the 1980s.[4] After 1989, he started and
operated his own company called The Carrara Group, a government affairs and
public relations company which was later acquired by [Burson-
Marsteller](/wiki/Burson-Marsteller "Burson-Marsteller"), the world's largest
public relations firm. Following the acquisition he got a job as the Executive
Vice President of corporate and government relations and marketing for [The
Howard Hughes Corporation](/wiki/The_Howard_Hughes_Corporation "The Howard
Hughes Corporation") and from 1994 to 1999, worked for the company, that is
also an affiliate of [The Rouse Company](/wiki/The_Rouse_Company "The Rouse
Company"). Yet, by 1999 Brown began to transition into the world of Las Vegas
casinos. He served as an Executive Vice President of government relations and
corporate communications for [Station Casinos, Inc.](/wiki/Station_Casinos
"Station Casinos") from 1999 to 2000.

### R&R
Partners[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Mark_E._Brown&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: R&R Partners")]

Brown was the founder and owner of Brown & Partners in 2000, which merged with
[R&R Partners](/wiki/R%26R_Partners "R&R Partners") in 2004. The merger helped
bring a $226 million in combined capital in 2005, when the merger became
effective. R&R Partners is considered Nevada's largest public affairs, public
relations and full-service advertising agency. After the merger Brown served
as its President and Chief Executive Officer from 2004 to 2007.[5]

The company R&R Partners, is best known for creating the advertising campaign
slogan "[What Happens in Vegas, Stays in
Vegas](/wiki/Las_Vegas_Convention_and_Visitors_Authority#What_Happens_here,_stays_here
"Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority")" for the City of Las
Vegas.[2][3] Its "What happens here" slogan is not new, _see[What happens on
tour, stays on tour](/wiki/What_happens_on_tour,_stays_on_tour "What happens
on tour, stays on tour")_, yet the campaign brought Las Vegas a record-
breaking 37.4 million visitors in 2004. Since then the phrase has been used by
many celebrities. Gambling fan [Ben Affleck](/wiki/Ben_Affleck "Ben Affleck")
used it on [Saturday Night Live](/wiki/Saturday_Night_Live "Saturday Night
Live"). [Billy Crystal](/wiki/Billy_Crystal "Billy Crystal") used it to close
the 2004 [Oscars](/wiki/Oscars "Oscars"). It has been a clue on [Wheel of
Fortune](/wiki/Wheel_of_Fortune_\(U.S._game_show\) "Wheel of Fortune \(U.S.
game show\)"). In 2004 on [The Tonight Show](/wiki/The_Tonight_Show "The
Tonight Show") when [Jay Leno](/wiki/Jay_Leno "Jay Leno") asked [Laura
Bush](/wiki/Laura_Bush "Laura Bush") whether she had gambled or had seen a
[Chippendales show](/wiki/Chippendales "Chippendales") while visiting the Las
Vegas Strip, the then [First Lady](/wiki/First_Lady "First Lady") got a big
hand by replying, "Jay, what happened in Vegas, stays in Vegas."[6] In later
years the phrase was used as the title for a 2008 movie '[What Happens in
Vegas](/wiki/What_Happens_in_Vegas "What Happens in Vegas")' starring [Cameron
Diaz](/wiki/Cameron_Diaz "Cameron Diaz") and [Ashton
Kutcher](/wiki/Ashton_Kutcher "Ashton Kutcher"). It has also been used in the
2009 blockbuster hit [The Hangover](/wiki/The_Hangover_\(film\) "The Hangover
\(film\)").

### Other Corporate
Involvements[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Mark_E._Brown&action=edit&section=4&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Other Corporate Involvements")]

  * **Medicor Ltd** : Brown was also involved in Medicor Ltd. as its director in 2003. The company was founded in 1999 and was based in Las Vegas, Nevada. Medicor, Ltd., through its subsidiaries, engages in the development, manufacture, and marketing of breast implants and other implants primarily for the aesthetic, plastic, and reconstructive surgery markets worldwide. On June 29, 2007, MediCor Ltd, along with its affiliates, filed a voluntary petition for reorganization under Chapter 11 in the US Bankruptcy Court for the District of Delaware.[7]
  * **Service1 st Bank of Nevada** : He was a founder of Service1 st Bank of Nevada. He has been a director of Service1st Bank of Nevada since January 2007. Brown serves as a Director of Service1st. The bank’s capital was valued at the end of the first quarter of 2010 around $21 million and later bought by [Western Liberty Bancorp](/w/index.php?title=Western_Liberty_Bancorp&action=edit&redlink=1 "Western Liberty Bancorp \(page does not exist\)") and [Forbes](/wiki/Forbes "Forbes") Lister [Jason N. Ader](/w/index.php?title=Jason_N._Ader&action=edit&redlink=1 "Jason N. Ader \(page does not exist\)") the same year.[8][9]
  * **YourBuyer Worldwide, Inc.** : Brown served as the President of YourBuyer Worldwide, Inc., a global purchasing company.[10][11][12]

### Zen
Gaming[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Mark_E._Brown&action=edit&section=5&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Zen Gaming")]

Brown heard about a social networking Web site proposal that would feature
poker and be able to target ads to specific partners, he thought it sounded
like a good idea. Thus, he started a holding company called Zen Gaming and
acquired nlop.com, a successful online poker site Brown became the Chief
Executive Officer of Zen Gaming in 2007.[13] The website purchased initially
had problems in the US with the passing of the [Unlawful Internet Gambling
Enforcement Act](/wiki/Unlawful_Internet_Gambling_Enforcement_Act "Unlawful
Internet Gambling Enforcement Act"), yet Brown's combination of membership
poker and paid advertising space online offered new potential.[14]

Zen Gaming is based out of [Las Vegas](/wiki/Las_Vegas_Valley "Las Vegas
Valley") with wholly owned subsidiary divisions that include NewPoker LLC and
Advergaming LLC under which the acquired National League of Poker operates.
The company developed and patented two new poker games, [Royal hold
'em](/wiki/Royal_hold_%27em "Royal hold 'em") and [No River
Hold'em](/wiki/Community_card_poker#No_River_hold'em "Community card poker")
that have been approved by the [Nevada Gaming
Commission](/wiki/Nevada_Gaming_Commission "Nevada Gaming Commission") and
already are being played in the poker rooms at [Treasure Island Hotel and
Casino](/wiki/Treasure_Island_Hotel_and_Casino "Treasure Island Hotel and
Casino"), [Hard Rock Hotel](/wiki/Hard_Rock_Hotel "Hard Rock Hotel") and
[O'Sheas](/wiki/O%27Sheas "O'Sheas") on the [Las Vegas
Strip](/wiki/Las_Vegas_Strip "Las Vegas Strip").[15] Also, [Stephens Media
Group](/wiki/Stephens_Media_Group "Stephens Media Group"), owner of the
[Review-Journal](/wiki/Review-Journal "Review-Journal"), is one of Zen
Gaming's first partners. Using the company's software, the Review-Journal
launched a poker site, becoming the first newspaper in the country to offer
online poker.[1] Some of Zen Gaming's other partners include [Golden
Gaming](/wiki/Golden_Gaming "Golden Gaming") and [Lotus
Broadcasting](/wiki/Lotus_Broadcasting "Lotus Broadcasting"), a radio company
that owns the local affiliates for [ESPN Radio](/wiki/ESPN_Radio "ESPN Radio")
and [Fox Sports Radio](/wiki/Fox_Sports_Radio "Fox Sports Radio"),and pair of
local rock and Spanish-language stations.[1] It also has partnership deals
with [NBCSports.com](/wiki/NBCSports.com "NBCSports.com") since 2009.

The Zen Gaming's software platform was selected by Poker Productions, Inc.
under a continuing agreement with NBCsports.com to provide poker programming.
Poker Productions provides executive production services for the [National
Heads-Up Poker Championship](/wiki/National_Heads-Up_Poker_Championship
"National Heads-Up Poker Championship") and the [Poker After
Dark](/wiki/Poker_After_Dark "Poker After Dark") programs seen on
[NBC](/wiki/NBC "NBC").[16]

Brown later made partnerships with the [Ultimate Fighting
Championship](/wiki/Ultimate_Fighting_Championship "Ultimate Fighting
Championship") to set up poker rooms at their events. The UFC Poker Rooms
leveraged UFC’s massive fan base and tremendous brand equity with Zen’s
advergaming platform that the UFC considers "among the most robust, deeply
analytical online Advergaming platforms in the world."[17]
